instances.beat: protagonist receives anonymous call about impending danger
side character receives cryptic call with location information
antagonist receives update from unknown informant

similar_beats.alternatives: use text messages, in-person clandestine meetings, or found notes instead

dialogue fades out, music swells, fades into next scene

description_efficiency.recommendation: trust SFX and actors, cut excessive narration describing sounds and movements

final_recommendations: Eliminate 2 narrator lines that explicitly describe SFX (door creak, glass shattering) to save 11 words
Reduce door slam SFX from 7 to 3 occurrences and remove associated dialogue references
Cut tension music from 8 to 3 key moments, removing scene-setting descriptions that rely on it
Combine two authority confrontation scenes into one stronger scene, saving ~500 words
Replace 3 instances of specific sound descriptions in dialogue with more general reactions

overall_assessment.summary_text: The script shows significant redundancy issues, particularly in sound design with overused effects and music. While dialogue appears relatively clean, there are opportunities for optimization through trimming unnecessary phrases and eliminating narrator descriptions of sound effects. Scene structure has some repetitive patterns that could be consolidated. The current word count of 185,000 exceeds the target by 20,000 words, but estimated savings of 3,300 words fall short of the needed reduction, requiring more aggressive cuts.

scores.dialogue_assessment: Some repeated info, mostly clean dialogue with minor trimming opportunities
scores.sound_assessment: Significant redundancy with overused SFX and music, narrator-SFX overlap issues
scores.scene_assessment: Some similar scenes and repetitive patterns could be combined or varied
scores.efficiency_assessment: Moderate optimization opportunities available but insufficient to meet target reduction

strengths: Dialogue is generally efficient with minimal repetition
Scene purposes are clear and well-defined
Some narrator-SFX overlaps identified for easy elimination
weaknesses: Sound design suffers from overused effects (door slams, footsteps) and repetitive music cues
Current optimization estimates (3,300 words) won't meet the 20,000 word reduction target
Mysterious information delivery relies too heavily on predictable phone call pattern
Narrator unnecessarily describes sound effects that are already cued

Eliminate all narrator lines that explicitly describe SFX cues
Reduce footsteps SFX by 60% and vary surface types
